dct_title_s:
Totius Africa Nova Repræsentatio qua præter diverſos in ea Status et
          Regiones etiam Origo Nili et veris R.R.P.P. Mißionariorum Relationibus
          oſtenditur
dct_description_sm:
Cartouche provides an elaborate scene depicting natives on the Nile bank. Nearby are
        monkeys, a sheep and a tortoise. Cherubs floating above complete the picture. Even though
        the map includes a note declaring the accuracy for the source of the Nile, it proves to be
        inaccurate; Prime meridian through Tenerif.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Dr. Oscar I. Norwich collection of maps of Africa and its islands, 1486 - ca. 1865 courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
